document.docAuthor: Liu, Zhen, He, Jun-Hua, Chen, Xue-Xin & Gupta, Ankita
document.masterDocTitle: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

bibRefCitation.author: Nixon, G. E. J.
bibRefCitation.refString: Nixon, G. E. J. (1965) A reclassification of the tribe Microgasterini (Hymenoptera: Braconidae). Bulletin of the British Museum (Natural History), Entomology Series, Supplement 2, 1 - 284.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Apanteles diocles Nixon, 1965: 48
. Holotype ♀ (examined)— India [NHM, Fig. 104h ].
Chen & Song, 2004: 46
;
Shenefelt, 1972: 493
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Body length 2.3 mm , fore wing length 2.7 mm . Body black, hind femur reddish yellow. Posterior tangent to anterior ocellus transecting posterior ocelli, distance between fore and hind ocellus as long as diameter of hind ocellus. Antenna distinctly longer than body length, penultimate flagellomere 1.2× longer than wide. Interspaces between punctures on disc of mesonotum distinctly larger than its diameter. Areola on propodeum strongly defined, V-shaped apically, closed with strong costulae. Pterostigma 3.0× as long as its widest part, vein 1-R1 1.2× longer than pterostigma, vein r 2.0× longer than vein 2-SR, angled at junction. T1 parallel-sided, 2.0× longer than hind width, turned-over part shiny, and mostly smooth, longitudinal channel indistinct; T2 shiny and polished, 4.6× wider than long in the middle; T3 2.6× longer than T2. Ovipositor sheath slightly longer than hind tibia.

Host. According to literature,
Sylepta lunalis Guenée
( Crambidae ) ( Nixon, 1965 ).
Distribution. China ( Fujian , Guangdong , Guangxi , Guizhou , Hainan , Hebei , Hubei , Hunan , Sichuan , Yunnan , Zhejiang ); India , Indonesia , Philippines , Vietnam .
Remarks. Body colour varies from black to reddish brown.
